sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Ni (Nickel powder) - Metal supply stores; Tm (Thulium powder) - Rare earth material suppliers; Y (Yttrium powder) - Chemical supply stores or online suppliers
steps: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Ni (Nickel powder) - Metal supply stores; Tm (Thulium powder) - Rare earth material suppliers; Y (Yttrium powder) - Chemical supply stores or online suppliers
1. Measure out 20 g of boron powder using a precise scale.
5. Combine all measured powders in a clean, dry mixing container.
6. Use a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle to blend the powders thoroughly for 10 minutes, ensuring an even distribution.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure out 20 g of boron powder using a precise scale. 
 2. Measure 140 g of nickel powder. 
 3. Measure 10 g of thulium powder. 
 4. Measure 50 g of yttrium powder. 
 5. Combine all measured powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 
 6. Use a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle to blend the powders thoroughly for 10 minutes, ensuring an even distribution.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a sintering mold to match the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches).
2. Heat the mold in a furnace to 1200°C.
3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for proper bonding of materials.
heating.raw_text:
1. Transfer the mixed powders into a sintering mold to match the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 
 2. Heat the mold in a furnace to 1200°C. 
 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for proper bonding of materials.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace.
2. Allow the mold to cool in the furnace to room temperature gradually (approximately 4-6 hours) to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text:
1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace. 
 2. Allow the mold to cool in the furnace to room temperature gradually (approximately 4-6 hours) to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the cooled sample from the mold carefully.
2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges.
3. If required, apply a sealant to enhance surface durability.
4. Cure the sample at room temperature for an additional 24 hours before use.
post_processing.raw_text:
1. Remove the cooled sample from the mold carefully. 
 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges. 
 3. If required, apply a sealant to enhance surface durability. 
 4. Cure the sample at room temperature for an additional 24 hours before use.
